isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - REMOVE - OUTPUT SHAFT OIL SEAL

svcproc.title: OUTPUT SHAFT OIL SEAL

figure.caption: Figure 27. Output Shaft Oil Seal Assembly - Magnetic Speedometer
Figure 28. Output Shaft Oil Seal Assembly - Mechanical Speedometer

svcproc.para: Oil Leak Diagnosis- Prior to replacing seal, carefully inspect the transmission to make sure the oil leakage is coming from the seal. Pay particular attention to the gasketed surfaces of the rear bearing cover, rear countershaft bearing covers, and shift bar housing.

step1.para: Shift the transmission into 1st gear or low gear (low range) to prevent the output yoke from turning when you loosen the output yoke nut.
Remove the output yoke nut using a 70 mm or 2-3/4 inch socket.
Remove the output yoke. If necessary, use an output yoke puller (Figure 29).
Remove the speedometer sensors from the rear bearing cover.

note.para: If the sensor is a thread-in type, note the number of threads exposed so that the sensor can be re-installed to the same depth. If the sensor is a push-in type, remove the hold down bolt and pull the sensor out of the bore.

step1.para: Remove the speedometer rotor/seal sleeve and the O-ring.

For transmissions with magnetic speedometers, pry the seal out using a large screwdriver or pry bar in the metal groove of the seal (Figure 30). For transmissions with mechanical speedometers, use a slide hammer with a hook attachment to remove the seal.

note.para: The seal will be damaged during removal and must be replaced.

step1.para: Remove seal slinger from the speedometer rotor/seal sleeve using a brass drift and hammer ( Figure 31).
